posts.post_content:
I'm slowly attempting a Chase Blue Portrait 'front run' of sorts---looking for defaced cards,print oddities,you name it....can anybody help?
thanks,Daniel

Good luck, it's a fun project.  Only oddity I have seen is the yellow brown printers scrap. 

[IMG]https://c1.staticflickr.com/9/8414/8832496358_5e24de6a96_c.jpg[/IMG]

There is another with a gray shift (up) where the name on the uniform is ghosted. Post #66:

[url]http://www.net54baseball.com/showthread.php?t=118253&highlight=oddities[/url]

There is a pink Chase with a crop mark on the back, but I don't think there is a blue Chase with one. Outside of the scrap Chris mentioned (I think there are two of those, Chris can correct me there), the only oddities I have seen are back stamps like the triple-stamped card I have:

[url]https://www.flickr.com/photos/132359235@N05/18353256094/in/album-72157654788552062/[/url]

Another possibility is to look for varying shades of blue, some are darker/lighter than others. This will be tough bc you will have to trust scans.

Good luck in your hunt, please post anything you find, I would love to see them.
thanks for the encouragement---i'll keep the board apprised of my sure-to-be slow progress::

There is a Chase blue portrait (Old Mill back) with a yellow crop line on the front and also a Chase blue portrait with Zimmerman's name on the top of the card.

Not sure about the Chase with the crop line, but its safe to say it would take quite a lot to pry the Chase/Zimmerman out of the current owner's collection.

I have scans of both T206s if you would like to see them.


Jantz
